data.title: Context menu "Show in explorer" error
data.body:
Platform: win

Context menu "Show in Exlplorer" executes (shellExecute) a file insted of opening explorer 
in directory of the selected file.
It's an error (compare with Brackets)
It's also usefull feature.
IMHO we should hava both "Execute" and corrected "Show in Explorer" options.

BRGS
Franček

data.title: Middle Mouse Button Sroll Cursor Not Visible
data.body: The middle mouse button scroll mode, which is available in most Windows applications, works, although it does not display the cursor -- the cursor just straight-up disappears when you press the middle mouse button.

Fixes #2672 
Fixes #2722 

This is an extension of #2722 . I just added specs.

data.title: Import base *-variables files as fallback vars when loading packages/themes
data.body:
Previous to this, theme authors needed to replicate the entire `ui-variables` or `syntax-variables` files in their themes. This pull makes it so they can just include the variables they want to override in their version of the `*-variables` file.

It didnt work like this previously because we would just pass a stack of import directories to the less compiler, and the first variables file won. If something used a variable not defined in that winning `*-variables` file, it'd die. 

This pull always imports the [fallback variables](https://github.com/atom/atom/tree/master/static/variables) on all package / theme files before importing anything else.

Fixes #2892; Requires atom/less-cache#3

data.title: Multiple Cursors, Screen Rotation conflict on Windows
data.body:
So the keyboard shortcut for creating a new cursor above or below on Windows is Ctrl-Alt-Up and Ctrl-Alt-Down.

Windows uses Ctrl-Alt-[arrow key] for screen rotation. Thus when you attempt to create an extra cursor, your screen flips upside down

data.title: Add portable version of Atom
data.body: I don’t really stick to one computer to program, and some computers don’t have editors. Currently I use Sublime Text portable, but it would be great if there was a portable version of Atom.

data.title: Maximized state not restored
data.body:
When starting Atom, the maximized state of the window should be restored to what it was the last time Atom was closed.
Atom is never maximized on startup although the height and width are restored, causing the window to slightly be overlapped by the Windows Taskbar.

Using Atom 0.114.0 x64 on Windows.

data.title: unsafe-eval is not allowed - depd
data.body:
About 26 days ago depd [added a bit of code](https://github.com/dougwilson/nodejs-depd/commit/e5430b4c75b325f83b2351480f88a1f0f28232b2) that uses eval. It seems like that broke atom entirely (nothing besides the core editor will load).

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1049204/3554660/e34ad8ce-090e-11e4-9d26-56ac937ca323.png)

data.title: Error with node-gyp when installing any packages or themes
data.body:
I'm on Linux Mint 15, just recently built Atom. When trying to install a package or theme (I've tried Twilight Syntax theme and the Emacs Mode package) I get the following error (this is for the theme but the package one is almost identical). I can't seem to figure out what's wrong. It seems to be a problem with node-gyp - I tried installing it via npm but atom still uses the previous version.

gyp info it worked if it ends with ok
gyp info using node-gyp@0.12.2
gyp info using node@0.10.26 | linux | x64
gyp http GET https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp http 200 https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist/v0.11.10/node-v0.11.10.tar.gz
gyp ERR! UNCAUGHT EXCEPTION 
gyp ERR! stack Error: EPERM, utime '/home/jacob/.atom/.node-gyp/.node-gyp/0.11.10'
gyp ERR! System Linux 3.8.0-19-generic
gyp ERR! command "/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/bin/node" "/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "install" "--target=0.11.10" "--dist-url=https://gh-contractor-zcbenz.s3.amazonaws.com/atom-shell/dist" "--arch=x64"
gyp ERR! cwd /home/jacob/.atom
gyp ERR! node -v v0.10.26
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v0.12.2
gyp ERR! This is a bug in `node-gyp`.
gyp ERR! Try to update node-gyp and file an Issue if it does not help:
gyp ERR!     https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-gyp/issues

I'm considering submitting an issue to node-gyp as stated in the last line but I wanted to make sure it can't be fixed here.

data.title: Possibility to hide the menu bar on Windows
data.body:
Possibility to hide the menu bar on windows. I takes up unnecessary space and it's barely being used because of the command palette and hotkeys for remaining functionality.

![Hide menu example](http://f.cl.ly/items/2s2N3B0f2u050A2k0T2t/atomwindows.png)

data.title: Opening a file with encoding
data.body:
Atom should definitely have an option to open file with user-chosen encoding. Currently as I can see there is only a UTF-8 support.

Encoding selection when opening and saving a file is an absolutely must-have. And features such as an automatic encoding detection may be currently postponed for future releases.

data.title: Page Up/Page Down on numeric keypad broken on Windows
data.body:
Related to #2921 

Windows 7, Atom version 0.113.0

data.title: TextBuffer::setText won't doesn't work
data.body:
Calling `TextBuffer::setText` to the Buffer, the content will be replaced again by the file content on the disk.

So I must call `buffer.save()` after `buffer.setText('something')`. However this is not what we want.

data.title: Multiple regex on one line break syntax highlighting
Changed File Close Dialogue not usable with keyboard
data.body:
(this is possibly windows only, tested with 0.113.0)

**Steps To Reproduce**
- Open Atom
- Type something into a new editor or change an existing file (doesn't matter which)
- Attempt to close the tab (for example `Ctrl+W`)
- Correctly, a dialogue opens, that will give you a choice how to proceed

![close-dialog-keyboard-lacking](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/124909/3550749/38cadc72-08dd-11e4-8d71-83e665a150cd.png)

**current (faulty) behaviour**

The Keyboard is pretty much useless for this dialogue. You can only Hit `[Enter]` to save.

**Desired Behaviour**

These interactions all don't work, but would be very much needed, all of these are very much standard behaviour for any application:
- [X] `[left]` and `[right]` should switch focus between buttos (so we can select a different thing with keyboard only)
- [X] `[esc]` should Cancel
- [ ] `[alt]` should bring up shortcut labels (much like it does for the application menu, i.e. _F_ile, which means press `[Alt+F]`)
- [X] `[tab]` should cycle between the buttons, `[shift-tab]` should cycle backwards.

data.title: Change shift-delete to trigger core:cut in Win32 and Linux
data.body:
This behavior is standard WIndows and Linux for shift-delete.

Previously shift-delete was a redundant mapping, anyway. So this brings it further in line with expected behavior for Windows and Linux users.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3550681/6cae3d78-08dc-11e4-8ea4-61e81a35d5d5.png)

data.title: %1 is not a valid Win32 application (node issue)
data.body:
Latest Windows build 
(as of 15 minutes prior to opening this post), builds without errors (after `npm update`):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3549567/b118cc8c-08cb-11e4-818e-463de2f010f2.png)

But when launching Atom, I get this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3549576/c7784a52-08cb-11e4-9871-8175ad7a4e35.png)

As mentioned above, prior to this successful build, I had one which failed after which I did a quick `npm update` before trying it again, which then worked as above.

data.title: Args Should Be Optional For BufferedProcess On Windows
data.body:
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/31b3d8f9670041aab4ec1b0c515aa59b48a17a31/src/buffered-process.coffee#L48 results in the following error if null is passed for arguments on the _Windows_ platform:

> TypeError: Cannot call method 'map' of null

Please add a guard for this state.

data.title: Tab key inserts text "key: value, " instead of indent
data.body:
Put this into a file named test.js:

```
switch(x) {
  case 'A':
}
```

Place the cursor to the right of the colon. Press tab. Instead of an indent being added, the colon is replaced with the text "key: value, ".

I'm on Atom 0.113.0, Mac OS X, with Linter and Linter Jshint packages.

data.body:

![gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6254332/3547985/02cea5a6-08a4-11e4-970a-6c8761cc61a3.gif)

data.title: "Home" and "End" special keys from numeric keypad is not working @ windows
Move gutter member into a showLineNumbers observe block
data.body:
When `editor.showLineNumbers` is toggled, the `ReactEditorView.gutter` member becomes stale. This moves it under an observer for `editor.showLineNumbers` so when it is toggled, the `gutter` member is reinstated. 

This is required for atom/git-diff#30. Ideally there would be a way to decorate a node similarly to decorations so we didnt have to do this hackery and related bs in git-diff. Something like `decorateObject('gutter', {class: 'blah'})`.

data.title: Fix width too wide when softwrap enabled when editor can vertical scroll
data.body:
1. Enable softwrap on a longish md file. 
2. Scroll to the right
3. Editor twerk

![softwrap-wiggle](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3546128/d15e581e-087f-11e4-9356-9620c83851b7.gif)

`DisplayBuffer::getEditorWidthInChars()` is not taking into account the width of the scrollbar when the editor can vertically scroll.

This fix takes the scrollbar width into account all the time, even when it cannot scroll vertically. 

It might be cool to take the scrollbar into account only when the scrollbar is visible. But there are a couple problems:
- UX: when it switches from able to scroll to not able to scroll, it would reset the column, and reflow some lines. 
- It's a chicken and egg problem. Basically, to figure out if we need the scrollbar, we need to know all the screenlines, and to build the screenlines we need to know the softwrap column. But to figure out the softwrap column, we need to know if we show the scrollbar.

Here's what happens on resize of the editor in softwrap:

![screen shot 2014-07-10 at 3 29 37 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3546309/b89fa66e-0881-11e4-93c7-310c8c499314.png)

`UpdateAllScreenLines` [deletes all the old screen lines](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/display-buffer.coffee#L94) then [figures out the softwrap column](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/display-buffer.coffee#L366), so it cannot know whether or not there should be a vert scrollbar. 

Here are the ways I can think to get the proper column:
- We keep the old screenlines around, and determine scrollability based on those. Though there might be cases where it does the wrong thing because the screen lines changed drastically (say a huge resize).
- We compute the screen lines twice. Once with the scrollbar, if it isnt scrollable, then compute again without the scrollbar.
- Just account for the scrollbar all the time (as this pull does)

I'd prefer to merge this pull. Curious about your thoughts

data.title: test
data.body: test

data.title: Allow grammars to specify tab style
data.body:
GNU Make requires the use of hard tabs, but our current setup doesn't allow grammars to specify tab styles. This PR will allow grammars to specify 'requiresHardTabs' which will override any other softTab preference.

**BUT**

I'm wondering if this approach is too shortsighted. I like what @jtkiley recommends in https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/122#issuecomment-44845687. But that will clash with the grammar approach I took here.

Started because of https://github.com/atom/language-make/issues/3 and https://github.com/atom/language-make/pull/8/files

data.title: Line numbers not immediately shown after being toggled
data.body:
In the GIF below, I toggle the line numbers off and back on again. Notice that the line numbers show up only after I move the cursor (which probably forces the gutter to refresh). Happens only with the react editor.

![nums](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/3545578/2e15165e-0878-11e4-86c1-cc21b77ee51b.gif)

cc @benogle @nathansobo
